Birmingham, Alabama
October 31, 1960
Mr. William G. Harley, President
N.A.E.B.
DuPont Circle Office Building
Rooms 1119-1121
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N. W.
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Bill:
From my conversation with Harry in San Francisco, he indicated that NAEB
might be able to underwrite my trip to Japan next May to the tune of a few
hundred dollars. This was based on the possibility of my being able to
attend some meeting or conference related to our field of communication.
Harry said that this had been precedented in the case of John Schwarzwalder
last year in Europe.
My ability to make this trip to Japan for the purpose of attending the Rotary
International Convention, of which I am District Governor, will depend on
supplementary support from some sources. If I am able during my visit
there to make, maintain or bulwark present relationships in our field, I am
at your service.
I would sincerely appreciate your looking into the matter of possible meetÂ¬
ings or conferences being held in Japan during the last week of May or
during the first week in June, 1961. My route of travel will be by way of
Chicago, Seattle, Anchorage, Tokyo, Honolulu, Los Angeles. Might it be
possible that something enroute, if not actually in Japan, could serve the
same purpose?
I inquire at this date because so many plans hinge on whether I can actually
swing the matter financially. It will also be necessary to be designated by
the NAEB as an official representative in writing in order that I might use
such an official trip for income tax reduction purposes.
Your personal assistance and study of this question will be most sincerely
appreciated.
RDH/ml
